poem:
**Crystal Dreams**

In waves, we find our breath,
the ocean's pulse, a silent symphony.
Under Pink Floyd skies,
sun-cooked skin in shadowed embrace —
a flicker of film, of youth,
like saltwater on lips,
surreal, unbound,
in the phosphorescent midnight,
the earth turns endless,
and we ride, ephemeral,
beneath the moon's electric thread.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Crystal Voyager: the ultimate surfing film with a DIY spirit - and a Pink Floyd soundtrack In Australia by the late 1960s, the Beach Boys and Gidget were out, Durban poison, blotting paper acid and prog rock were in and surfing movies were the ultimate underground cinema. They combined abstract images with contemporary music; if the audience was a little baked, all the better. Films like The Endless Summer and Morning of the Earth promised". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
